intro: Babiana rivulicola, commonly known as the riverbank babiana, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils along riverbanks and slopes. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late summer. Babiana rivulicola is adapted to arid conditions and is often found in fynbos vegetation.
